definition: a book on the art of war
soldiers/a force/an army/weapons/arms/military/warlike/CL:個|个[ge4]
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
book/letter/document/CL:本[ben3],冊|册[ce4],部[bu4]/to write

sentences.english: Even I often find time to read books on the art of war and gain much benefit from them.
sentences.chinese: 我常常抽空閱讀兵書，從中得到了不少好處。

sentences.english: Military lexis are scattered throughout all kinds of literature, particularly in military works.
sentences.chinese: 這些詞語散見於各種文獻，尤以兵書爲主。

sentences.english: Even I find time to read books on the art of war, and they've benefited me greatly.
sentences.chinese: 我常常抽空閱讀兵書，從中得到了不少好處。

sentences.english: On the third hand the war had enough dialectic thought .
sentences.chinese: 第三章論述先秦兵書所體現的管理學思想。

definition: courtesy name of Zhao Yun 趙雲|赵云[Zhao4 Yun2], general of Shu in Romance of the Three Kingdoms
talented field commander (military)
superior judgment/sagacity
see 呂洞賓|吕洞宾[Lu:3 Dong4 bin1]
with a will, you can achieve anything (idiom); cf 精誠所至，金石為開|精诚所至，金石为开[jing1 cheng2 suo3 zhi4 , jin1 shi2 wei4 kai1]
lit. paper has become expensive in Luoyang (because everyone is making a copy of a popular story) (idiom)/fig. (of a product) to sell like hotcakes
sequel/continuation of a book
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
lit. to use a dog's tail as a substitute for sable fur (idiom)/fig. a worthless sequel to a masterpiece

the Book of History, one of the Five Classics of Confucianism 五經|五经[Wu3 jing1], a compendium of documents which make up the oldest extant texts of Chinese history, from legendary times down to the time of Confucius, also known as 尚書經|尚书经[Shang4 shu1 jing1], 尚書|尚书[Shang4 shu1], 書|书[Shu1]
running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
accepted theory or formulation
The Travels of Lao Tsan, novel by late Qing novelist Liu E 劉鶚|刘鹗[Liu2 E4]
Kaesong or Gaeseong city in southwest North Korea, close to the border with South Korea and a special economic zone for South Korean companies
tuning/temperament
well-rounded argument/general survey
